author: 证券之星股票
title: 利民股份（002734）6月19日11点29分触及跌停板_股票频道_证券之星
text:
证券之星6月19日盘中消息，11点29分利民股份（002734）触及跌停板。目前价格20.25，下跌10.0%。其所属行业农化制品目前下跌。领涨股为广康生化。该股为锂电池，钠电池，固态电池概念热股，当日锂电池概念上涨0.12%。
6月18日的资金流向数据方面，主力资金净流出9136.66万元，占总成交额4.98%，游资资金净流入194.41万元，占总成交额0.11%，散户资金净流入8942.24万元，占总成交额4.87%。
该股最近90天内共有7家机构给出评级，买入评级6家，增持评级1家。
以上内容为证券之星据公开信息整理，由AI算法生成（网信算备310104345710301240019号），不构成投资建议。

author: Baek Byung-yeul
title: Hyundai Motor takes over Hyundai Mobis’ fuel cell business - The Korea Times
text:
This image released by Hyundai Motor Group in 2021 shows the automotive group’s vision to build a green energy society utilizing hydrogen. The group aims to build fuel cell production, transportation and supply infrastructure. Courtesy of Hyundai Motor Group
Carmaker accelerates building hydrogen ecosystem By Baek Byung-yeul Hyundai Motor has acquired the fuel cell business of Hyundai Mobis, the auto parts arm of Hyundai Motor Group, as part of the group's strategy to consolidate its fuel cell business capability, the carmaker said Friday.
Hyundai Mobis said it signed an agreement to transfer its domestic fuel cell-related facilities, assets and personnel to Hyundai Motor.
Hyundai Mobis has been manufacturing fuel cell stacks, which generate electrical energy to power fuel cell electric vehicles (EVs), and fuel cell systems, another key component for hydrogen cars.
Hyundai Motor said the acquisition is intended to consolidate research and development capabilities in hydrogen, which it sees as a future core green energy source.
"This acquisition aims to accelerate establishment of the fuel cell ecosystem by securing fuel cell technology competitiveness and improving production quality,” the company said. “We will build an integrated structure where R&D and production can be smoothly linked and consequently create synergy.”
By acquiring Hyundai Mobis' hydrogen business, Hyundai Motor now takes charge of establishing a hydrogen value chain that encompasses all stages from fuel cell production, storage and transportation to utilization.
Hyundai Motor has been conducting R&D in related fields since 1998, foreseeing that fuel cells would be the answer to future energy needs. In 2013, the company produced the world's first fuel cell electric vehicle, the ix35.
Then in 2018, Hyundai Motor launched the fuel cell-powered Nexo SUV, taking the top spot in global hydrogen car sales. In 2020, it launched the Xcient fuel cell truck. As of now, the Xcient hydrogen trucks have driven over 8.7 million kilometers in Switzerland since 2020.
"Through this acquisition, we will contribute to the expansion of hydrogen electric car distribution by improving the performance, durability and production quality of hydrogen fuel cells," Hyundai Motor said.
At the 2024 CES tech trade show last month in Las Vegas, Hyundai Motor announced that it would provide a comprehensive hydrogen solution covering not only fuel cell cars but also the entire hydrogen value chain.
In order to create a hydrogen society that transitions from fossil fuels to hydrogen energy, the scale of hydrogen use must increase. To that end, Hyundai Motor said its aim to increase annual hydrogen consumption to more than 3 million tons by 2035.
"We will continue our efforts to diversify our business in non-vehicle sectors such as power generation, trams, ships and advanced air mobility," the company added.
baekby@koreatimes.co.kr More articles by this reporter

author: Emma Misiaszek
title: chevron-right
text: SYRACUSE, N.Y. — Former Syracuse basketball star Eric Devendorf’s ED23 Foundation will provide a little warmth at an upcoming Hat, Scarf, and Glove Giveaway event on Saturday. The giveaway will occur at the Boys & Girls Club, Central Village from 10 a.m. to noon. Devendorf will be there all morning to help with the giveaway. Sponsors include Printing & Promotional Solutions, Limp Lizard BBQ, Ale "N" Angus Pub and PTM Solar. Their support has made it possible for the ED23 Foundation to purchase over 1000 brand-new gloves, 1000 scarves, and 1000 hats. “Each scarf, glove, and hat is a small act of kindness, made possible by our sponsors whose commitment goes beyond business," Devendorf said. “It's our way of standing with Syracuse's underprivileged youth, a promise that they are seen, cared for, and valued.” Eric and the ED23 Foundation, supported by its sponsors, will be distributing these winter essentials to anyone in need. Todd Ruetsch, owner of Printing and Promotional Solutions and ED23 Foundation Chair said, "Growing up in Syracuse, I've seen the struggles firsthand. Being part of this initiative isn't just giving back; it's a way to pay it forward and make a tangible difference in these kids' lives. It's an honor to contribute to such a meaningful cause." For more information, click [here](https://ed23foundation.org/news/ed23-foundations-hat-scarf-and-glove-giveaway-bringing-a-little-warmth-to-syracuses-underprivileged-youth/).

author: VNExplorer
title: El CONTUNDENTE comunicado de Universitario tras los incidentes en amistoso con Colo Colo
text: El último miércoles, se suspendió el partido de preparación denominado 'duelo de los más campeones' entre Universitario de Deportes y Colo Colo de Chile en el Estadio Monumental David Arellano. Esto luego de que los hinchas del 'Cacique' y arrojaran bombardas hacia las tribunas donde permanecían los hinchas visitantes, según indica el comunicado oficial del conjunto de Ate. Ante este panorama, a través de las redes sociales, la institución merengue lanzó un comunicado en donde rechazan los hechos violentos que iniciaron por parte de los aficionados del cuadro 'Albo' en un duelo de carácter amistoso. Además, instaron a que se hallen a los responsables de los "actos de violencia". "Como es de conocimiento público, el encuentro fue suspendido por falta de garantías dentro del recinto deportivo, luego que la tribuna destinada a nuestra hinchada y donde se encontraban familias, fuera atacada cobardemente con bombardas", precisó el equipo crema. Universitario de Deportes Comunicado de Universitario de Deportes/Foto: X De igual modo, Universitario explicó que parte de los integrante del plantel decidieron brindar el apoyo necesario a hinchas locales que fueron agredidos: "En medio de esta emergencia, nuestros futbolistas acudieron al auxilio de una madre y su hijo herido. Ante la ausencia del socorro inmediato, nuestro jugador Diego Dorregaray acudió en su defensa, por lo que ha sido citado a rendir su manifestación". "Consideramos que la vida de una persona está por encima de cualquier circunstancia. En tal sentido, manifestamos que nuestra delegación actuó para proteger a nuestros hinchas en peligro", añadieron. Finalmente, el cuadro estudiantil exigió a las autoridades chilenas que puedan dar con los responsables de los incidentes que terminaron afectando a hinchas de Universitario que se encontraban en su tribuna respectiva. "Instamos a la industria del fútbol a seguir trabajando por crear espacios seguros en beneficio de las familias".

author: VNExplorer
title: 'Supercell' thunderstorm set to strike North West after 'localised tornado' causes chaos
text:
‘Supercell’ thunderstorm set to strike North West after ‘localised tornado’ causes chaos
The Met Office has warned of a ‘supercell’ thunderstorm that is about to hit the North West after reports of a ‘localised tornado’.
Around 100 homes were damaged in Stalybridge, Tameside, as Storm Gerrit swept across the country last night. Numerous reports were made to Greater Manchester Police at around 11.45pm on Wednesday, and the force declared a major incident due to the “severity” of the damage caused and the potential risk to public safety.
No injuries were reported but many residents were forced to leave their homes.
Forecasters have since predicted a ‘supercell’ thunderstorm is about to hit parts of Lancashire, with added heavy rain and hail. It’s likely to remain windy, especially on higher ground, the Met Office has said.
In a post shared on X – formerly Twitter – the Met Office said: “A supercell thunderstorm is currently moving east across Morecambe Bay, Lancashire. In addition to heavy rain and some hail, frequent lightning and strong and gusty winds may affect parts of #Lancashire in the next hour or so.”
